Most front-end applications need to communicate with a server over the HTTP protocol, to download or upload data and access other back-end services. Angular provides a client HTTP API for Angular applications, the `HttpClient` service class in `@angular/common/http`.

## [HTTP client service features](https://angular.dev/guide/http\#http-client-service-features)

The HTTP client service offers the following major features:

- The ability to request [typed response values](https://angular.dev/guide/guide/http/making-requests#fetching-json-data)
- Streamlined [error handling](https://angular.dev/guide/guide/http/making-requests#handling-request-failure)
- Request and response [interception](https://angular.dev/guide/guide/http/interceptors)
- Robust [testing utilities](https://angular.dev/guide/guide/http/testing)

## [What's next](https://angular.dev/guide/http\#whats-next)
